material.mattext: Write an expression for the cost to the university

The cost to university for offering this course is 8000+45X: $8000 to the instructor, and $45 for each registered student, the number of which is expressed by the random variable X. Note that the cost is an expression of the type a+bx, where a=8000 and b=45. The first set of rules for means and variances tells us that: the mean of (a+bX) = a + b * (the mean of X) the variance of (a+bX) = b squared * the variance of X
